data.title: Speakers Roster
data.meta_description: American presenter and former diplomat James Rubin knows his way around the White House. As part of the Bill Clinton administration Rubin served as US Assistant Secretary of State for Public Affairs alongside the first female Secretary of State Madeleine Albright for three years.
data.text:
James P. Rubin, a distinguished American former diplomat and journalist, has left an indelible mark on the realms of international affairs and media. Serving as the U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for Public Affairs in the Clinton Administration from 1997 to 2000, Rubin played a crucial role in shaping the nation’s public diplomacy strategies during a pivotal period.

Following his diplomatic tenure, Rubin transitioned seamlessly into the world of journalism, writing a regular column on foreign affairs for The Sunday Times of London. His insightful analyses and commentary further solidified his reputation as a thought leader in international relations.

Rubin’s journey also led him to the realm of television, where he became a Sky News presenter with his own show, “World News Tonight.” Although short-lived, his foray into broadcast journalism showcased his ability to communicate complex global issues to a wide audience. Following the show’s cancellation, Rubin continued to contribute as a commentator for the channel.

In 2013, Rubin made a significant move, relocating from New York City to London, England, where he currently resides. His personal and professional life has been intertwined with prominent journalist Christiane Amanpour, and the two have a teenage son together.

Presently, Rubin serves as the Diplomatic Counselor to the newly elected Secretary General of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD). His wealth of experience, both in diplomacy and media, positions him as a valuable asset in navigating the complexities of international relations. Additionally, Rubin was appointed Special Envoy and Coordinator of the State Department’s Global Engagement Center in December 2022, underscoring his ongoing commitment to shaping and influencing global narratives.
